intro: Vilfa ciliata var. subfasciculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved vilfa, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, ciliate (fringed) leaves and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
